description.narrative: The government of Guinea in its National Economic and Social Development Plan (PNDES) 2016-2020 placed industrial development as central instrument to accelerate its economic diversification and structural transformation for inclusive and sustainable development. The PNDES is structures in four pillars and sectoral and cross-sectoral strategic programmes and projects. The UNIDO Cooperation Framework (Country Programme) has been identified in the PNDES as one of the PNDES underlying strategic programme. In that regard, UNIDO was requested in 2018 by the Government through the Ministry of Industry to support in the development and implementation of a Country Programme that match the post-EBOLA recovery context around the PNDES and the UNDAF 2018-2022. Following the request of the Government of the Republic of Guinea, and a series of consultations between the Government and UNIDO in 2017-2018, the parties agreed to develop jointly a new technical cooperation framework in the form of a country programme. Aligned to the renewed UNIDO ISID mandate, the CP focuses on autonomous but flexible components in order to: (I) Respond to changes that may occur during the operationalization of the country programme; (ii) Facilitate the mobilization of funds and (iii) Promote more efficient implementation. This CP focuses on UNIDO specific contributions to Guinea national development framework by aligning with national priorities as defined by the PNDES, the UNDAF (2018-2022), the document "Guinea, Vision 2040" and the National Policy Letter of Small and Medium Enterprises (LPN / SME). Otherwise, this Country Programme is also part of the reference framework for the implementation of UNIDO strategy and operational plan for Least Developed Countries (LDCs) over the 2012-2020 period. The current CP framework developed through a participative process led by a national committee led by the office of the Prime Minister and the Ministry of Industry. The CP estimated at budget 21,950,000 $US, is structured into on five (5) components: • Component 1: Development of selected value chains and agro-industry. • Component 2: Industrial competitiveness and SME development. • Component 3: Strengthen the employability and entrepreneurial capacities of young people and women. • Component 4: Promotion of clean energies, industrial efficiency and good practices. • Component 5: Mobilization and coordination of partnerships for inclusive and sustainable industrial development.
